channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Troops stand by to enter Minnesota. And, Trump plans for a Board of Peace
item.description: Minnesota braces for federal troops amid immigration protests. And, Trump asks nations to buy into a new U.S.-led board of peace to manage Gaza and other world conflicts.
item.content:encoded:
Minnesota braces for federal troops amid immigration protests. And, Trump asks nations to buy into a new U.S.-led board of peace to manage Gaza and other world conflicts.

(Image credit: Scott Olson)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Hundreds of active-duty troops on are standby to deploy to Minnesota, Trump escalates tensions across Europe with new threats over Greenland, Israel raises objections over Trump's Board of Peace.
item.content:encoded: Hundreds of active-duty troops on are standby to deploy to Minnesota, Trump escalates tensions across Europe with new threats over Greenland, Israel raises objections over Trump's Board of Peace.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: Martin Luther King III, Martin Luther King Jr.'s son, reflects on his father's legacy
item.description: Martin Luther King III, the son of Martin Luther King Jr. and Coretta Scott King, reflects on his father's legacy and what he considers today's most urgent social justice issues.
item.content:encoded: Martin Luther King III, the son of Martin Luther King Jr. and Coretta Scott King, reflects on his father's legacy and what he considers today's most urgent social justice issues.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: Martin Luther King Jr. would be inspired by today's activism, author says
item.description: Heather McGhee, author of 2021's The Sum of Us, discusses the economic cost of racism, the importance of community organizing and the "zero-sum lie" that progress for some means loss for others.
item.content:encoded: Heather McGhee, author of 2021's The Sum of Us, discusses the economic cost of racism, the importance of community organizing and the "zero-sum lie" that progress for some means loss for others.
item.dc:creator: Tonya Mosley

item.title: The 2026 Olympics are the most widespread in history. See what's happening where
item.description: Competitions will be hosted at 25 venues spanning an area of more than 8,000 square miles. Here's what's happening at each of the four main clusters.
item.content:encoded: Competitions will be hosted at 25 venues spanning an area of more than 8,000 square miles. Here's what's happening at each of the four main clusters.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: U.S. lawmakers wrap reassurance tour in Denmark as tensions around Greenland grow
item.description: A bipartisan congressional delegation traveled to Denmark to try to deescalate rising tensions. Just as they were finishing, President Trump announced new tariffs on the country until it agrees to his plan of acquiring Greenland.
item.content:encoded:
A bipartisan congressional delegation traveled to Denmark to try to deescalate rising tensions. Just as they were finishing, President Trump announced new tariffs on the country until it agrees to his plan of acquiring Greenland.

(Image credit: Nichlas Pollier)
item.dc:creator: Barbara Sprunt

item.title: Trump has rolled out many of the Project 2025 policies he once claimed ignorance about
item.description: Some of the 2025 policies that have been implemented include cracking down on immigration and dismantling the Department of Education.
item.content:encoded:
Some of the 2025 policies that have been implemented include cracking down on immigration and dismantling the Department of Education.

(Image credit: Samuel Corum)
item.dc:creator: Franco Ordoñez

item.title: Can exercise and anti-inflammatories fend off aging? A study aims to find out
item.description: New research is underway to test whether a combination of high-intensity interval training and generic medicines can slow down aging and fend off age-related diseases. Here's how it might work.
item.content:encoded:
New research is underway to test whether a combination of high-intensity interval training and generic medicines can slow down aging and fend off age-related diseases. Here's how it might work.

(Image credit: NurPhoto)
item.dc:creator: Allison Aubrey

item.title: At least 39 dead in Spain train collision as rescuers search for more bodies
item.description: Spanish police said Monday that at least 39 people died in the a high-speed train collision Sunday in southern Spain and rescue efforts were continuing.
item.content:encoded:
Spanish police said Monday that at least 39 people died in the a high-speed train collision Sunday in southern Spain and rescue efforts were continuing.

(Image credit: Francisco J. Olmo)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: In Los Angeles, Iranian-Americans march against government crackdown in Iran
item.description: Marchers gathered Sunday in downtown L.A. against the Iranian crackdown on the protests that have taken place over recent weeks.
item.content:encoded: Marchers gathered Sunday in downtown L.A. against the Iranian crackdown on the protests that have taken place over recent weeks.
item.dc:creator: Sarah McCammon
